p: Between 2014 and 2016, 325 cases of WA-MCF were reported at Kapiti Plains Ranch. Diagnosis was based on clinical signs including pyrexia, bilateral corneal opacity, serosanguinous nasal discharge and lachrymation. Additional clinical signs associated with WA-MCF were also considered but not observed in all cases. These included dyspnea/coughing, inappetence, neurological signs, salivation and weakness. Information regarding age and gender were recorded for each animal. Blood samples were opportunistically collected from 123 cases of clinically suspected WA-MCF and 51 clinically healthy animals.
